data.enText: one of a group of senior managers who run a company
He's on the board of directors .
a person who is in charge of a particular activity or department in a company, a college, etc.
data.chText: （某一活动的）负责人；（公司部门的）主任，经理；（学院的）院长

data.enText: a person in charge of a film/movie or play who tells the actors and staff what to do

tr: the person who leads a musical group
someone who controls resources and expenditures
someone who supervises the actors and directs the action in the production of a show
member of a board of directors
the person who directs the making of a film

value.def: The director of a play, film, or television programme is the person who decides how it will appear on stage or screen, and who tells the actors and technical staff what to do.

example.ex: ...the director of the intensive care unit at Guy's Hospital.
example.tran: 盖伊医院重症护理病房的主任
(英格兰以及威尔士的)检察官

example.ex: She has just been appointed artistic director of Queensland Theatre Company.
example.tran: 她刚刚被任命为昆士兰剧团的艺术总监。

value.def: In some organizations and public authorities, the person in charge is referred to as the director .

example.ex: He served on the board of directors of a local bank.
example.tran: 他是当地一家银行的董事会成员之一。

example.ex: ...Karl Uggerholt, the financial director of Braun UK.
example.tran: 卡尔·乌格洛尔特，贝朗英国分公司的财务经理

value.def: The directors of a company are its most senior managers, who meet regularly to make important decisions about how it will be run.
The director of an orchestra or choir is the person who is conducting it.

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 conductor

partsOfSpeech.dec: direct adj.直达的 + -ion 行为,状态
direct adj.直达的 + -ory 场所,地点
emper 命令,统治 + -or 人/物
pro- 向前,在前 + fess 说 + -or 人/物
s- + cis 切,割 + -s- + -or 人/物
an- 前 + cest 行走;前进 + -or 人/物
auth- 增加,创造 + -or 人/物
con- 共同, 一起 + duct 引导 + -or 人/物
elevate 举起,提拔 + -or 人/物
horr 颤抖,害怕 + -or 人/物
operat(e) 运作;操作 + -or 人/物

partsOfSpeech.d: (尤指为顾客个别定制男装的)裁缝

partsOfSpeech.dec: tut 照管,监护 + -or 人/物
